Topic: Illustrate plants with and without water.
Level Description: Proficient (shows most elements clearly and correctly)
CAN: The student can draw a healthy plant that has water available to it, showing clear and lively features like green leaves and a sturdy stem.
The student can draw a plant that is wilting or not growing due to lack of water, depicting features such as drooping leaves or a brownish hue.
The student can generally demonstrate that plants need water to live and grow, by contrasting healthy and wilting plants.
The student can depict a sunny environment where plants are thriving, indicating sunlight with rays or a bright sun.
CANNOT: The student might inconsistently show a dark or dry environment where plants are not growing well, possibly forgetting to darken the sky or leaving soil details incomplete.
The student may omit some elements that show the complete pattern of growth dependence on water, such as a clear depiction of water sources or inconsistent watering lines.
(student understands core concept but misses some visual details)
